title: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When opening an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository, and making the file dirty by adding a space character to the end of the first line, it takes about 8 seconds to close the editor, answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, and reopen the file by double-clicking in the navigator. However, if I select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor after performing steps 1 and 2, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: I expect the 'Revert' operation to be as fast or at least comparable to the close and reopen sequence of actions in the java editor.
SR:
1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 
2) Add a space character to the end of the first line to make the file dirty. 
3) Close the editor. 
4) When prompted to save changes, select 'no'. 
5) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 

-OR-

1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 
2) Add a space character to the end of the first line to make the file dirty. 
3) Right-click on the editor to open the pop-up menu. 
4) Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu.
